imdb.title: Fumetsu no Anata e
imdb.plot: A lonely boy wandering the Arctic regions of North America meets a wolf, and the two become fast friends, depending on each other to survive the harsh environment. But the boy has a history, and the wolf is more than meets the eye...

episodes.title: Special: Fushi's Journey
episodes.plot: A recap of Fushi's journey and moments narrated by the Beholder.

episodes.title: Infatuation Reborn
episodes.plot: With the loss of Pioran, Fushi went into a self-imposed exile on a deserted island. Finally, 40 years later, Fushi remains alone, save for his black-clad creator, The Observer.

episodes.title: Beating Will
episodes.plot: Tonari is attacked by the Nokker on Hisame's arm. Although Fushi later reunites with his old friend, he does not get to spend much time with her as she passes away soon afterward.

episodes.title: The Awaited
episodes.plot: Fushi learns from Hayase's sixth successor that the Church of Bennett has declared him a heretic and announced a huge reward for capturing him.

episodes.title: The Young Man Who Can See
episodes.plot: Bonchien continues to offer all his support to Fushi so that he stays in the Uralis Kingdom. However, Fushi's fear of a Nokker attack continues to haunt him but the prince goes a step further by publicly giving him the Best Bonnist Award.

episodes.title: The Holy Man's Voyage
episodes.plot: Fushi as he embarks on a long journey with Bonchien and his large army. They eventually reach the Uga Castle where Fushi is requested by the cast-lord Anna to help his daughter who is on her deathbed.

episodes.title: Heretics Betrayed
episodes.plot: Fushi and his companions arrive in Entus city where a large gathering has been organized. But the Church of Bennett manipulates Fushi and takes him captive.

episodes.title: Crime and Forgiveness
episodes.plot: Bonchien meets a boy who is kept in the same cell as him. Over time he starts caring for him and eventually starts seriously contemplating his motivations to become the king.

episodes.title: Beyond Dreams
episodes.plot: Fushi saves Bon's life just moments before he is executed by the Church of Bennett. But in order to fool the public and the church, he smartly places a dummy body at the execution spot.

episodes.title: Expanding Consciousness
episodes.plot: Fushi goes to rescue people living near the head church of the Church of Bennett after he learns that there will be a Nokker attack there. While he does his best, a lot of people lose their lives.

episodes.title: Resonance
episodes.plot: Fushistarts to live isolated, which can give him a critical advantage in the battle against the Nokkers. Interestingly, he discovers a town nearby where he ends up freeing a girl name Eko and his brother from captivity.

episodes.title: The Value of Flesh
episodes.plot: Fushi, Kahaku, and Eko finally reach the city of Renril. Meanwhile, Bonchien begins marshaling the troops in the Uralis Kingdom and eventually selects three vessels for Fushi.

episodes.title: Secret Behind the Veil
episodes.plot: Fushi and the others were able to gain the trust of the princess and the people, and everyone is helping Fushi in rebuilding the houses, but his identity is still hidden.

episodes.title: The Wise Man's Identity
episodes.plot: Fushi announced his intention to the people of Renril. And contrary to what they thought until now, all the people saw him as a savior

episodes.title: Morning of Rebirth
episodes.plot: Fushi finishes the reconstruction of the castle and the last stage of Renril's preparation is finished. The war begins.

episodes.title: The Self, Worn Down
episodes.plot: In order to protect Renril, Fushi connects himself to different parts of Renril and because of this, he is put under extreme pressure and faints. Now it is up to others to protect Renril from attacks.

episodes.title: Three Eternal Warriors
episodes.plot: Fushi has won the battle against the Nokker. The joint struggle with Tonari and the Jananda islanders changed Fushi's mind. That night, Fushi sit down with the children and talks about their dreams.

episodes.title: What You Want to Protect
episodes.plot: New Nokkers attacked citizens and the surrounding area. Fushi is unaware of his true power, which is the ability to revive the dead. After the argument with Kahaku, while tied up by the soldiers after his left arm attacked a woman.

episodes.title: Death of the Deathless
episodes.plot: March stops the Nokkers from attacking further. She and Bon searches the city for Fushi and seem to discover that he is dead, raising concern about how he passed away even though he was immortal.

episodes.title: And Then, Dawn
episodes.plot: In the beginning, it was an orb. And Fushi was an orb once again. But though there was no certainty, there was hope.

episodes.title: End of an Era
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: The Last One
episodes.plot: A sphere that absorbs shapes around it is thrown into the world so you can watch what happens in it. It's slow metamorphoses provide him with remarkable experiences.

episodes.title: A Rambunctious Girl
episodes.plot: The orb, having morphed into a boy, finds it's way to Ninanna, where he is attacked. He is discovered by a girl, March, who may not achieve her goal of becoming a grown-up.

episodes.title: A Minor Evolution
episodes.plot: March is escorted to the altar to be sacrificed to Oniguma. Along the way, she tends to Fushi, who despite having the body of a young man, doesn't seem to have the mind of one.

episodes.title: A Large Vessel
episodes.plot: Hayase, interested in Fushi's inability to die, brings him along with March, Parona and Pioran to the nation of Yanome. They are shown around town and treated well, but things are not as they seem.

episodes.title: Those Who Follow
episodes.plot: Parona and the others escape from the prison under the cover of night and begin their trek back home. But Hayase and her warriors catch up to them.

episodes.title: Our Goals
episodes.plot: Wandering through the forest, Fushi encounters the old woman Pioran. As they journey towards a town, she teaches him how to write and speak.

episodes.title: The Boy Who Wants to Change
episodes.plot: A young boy named Gugu and his older brother work hard to save up their money. One day, Gugu comes home to find that both his brother and the savings are gone.

episodes.title: Monster Brothers
episodes.plot: Rean begins working at Booze Man's liquor store with Gugu and Fushi. Gugu runs away when he learns an unsettling secret.

episodes.title: Deep Memories
episodes.plot: After helping Gugu recover, Fushi tells him about his earliest experiences. Gugu recalls the time when he and his brother worked for a rich family.

episodes.title: New Family
episodes.plot: Fushi and Gugu struggle against the mysterious enemy "Nokkers" while protecting each other, but in a pinch of desperation, Gugu notices Nokker's weakness and unleashes an attack that only he can do.

episodes.title: Gift From the Past
episodes.plot: Ahead of her 16th birthday, Rean complains to Fushi that her parents expect her to marry a man she has never met. Shin arrives outside the shop.

episodes.title: Awakening
episodes.plot: When Gugu and Rean are about to confess their love for each other, a Nokker attacks the party, sending the guests into panic. Fushi and Gugu attempt to fight it but Gugu's special skill has no effect.

episodes.title: Aspiring to Go Higher
episodes.plot: After the events at Rean's house, Fushi departs in order to keep others safe from him, and better himself.

episodes.title: Jananda, Island of Freedom
episodes.plot: Trapped in an isolated island, Fushi, encouraged by the kids who brought him, enters the coliseum tournament with the hope of freeing Pioran.

episodes.title: A Girl Named Tonari
episodes.plot: Fushi attempts to free Pioran from prison, however, he is told to leave by Pioran herself. Fushi continues to fight in the arena but angers the crowd by continually refusing to kill others. The Nokkers once again return to fight Fushi.

episodes.title: The Children's Dreams
episodes.plot: Tonari reflects on her life and her father. Fushi prepares for the final battle in the arena, deciding the leader of the island. During his battle, Fushi meets an old foe and discovers the fate of an old friend.

episodes.title: The Defeated
episodes.plot: Hayase manages to incapacitate Fushi, making her the winner of the tournament and the new leader of the islands. Hayase then decides to name Tonari as the leader while attempting to imprison Fushi. Tonari then looks to free Fushi.

episodes.title: To Continue On
episodes.plot: Tonari returns to the island in order to rescue Fushi. Fushi and Tonari prepare to set sail off the island, however, before doing so, they decide to head back in order to deal with the Nokkers that threaten the island.

episodes.title: Wandering Rage
episodes.plot: Fushi and Tonari fight the Nokker invasion, but Hayase sees an opportunity in the chaos that she's not willing to lose.

episodes.title: Echoes
episodes.plot: After departing from Jananda, Fushi seeks out Pioran.
